intro: Hieracium vulgatum var. anfractum, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces yellow composite flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats, often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its flowering period typically occurs from late spring to early autumn, contributing to its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
